00058 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00059 #include <config.h>
00060 #include "l_softpipe_int.h"
00061 #include "l_mve.h"
00062 #include "l_pipe_sync.h"
00063 #include <Lcode/r_regalloc.h>
00064 
00065 #define UNKNOWN_WEIGHT 0        /* cb has weight which can't be estimated   */
00066 
00067 #define FALL_THRU_EPI 0         /* epilogue for fall through out of kernel  */
00068 #define TARGET_EPI 1            /* epilogue for taken kernel or prolog exit */
00069 
00070 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------
00071                      Remainder loop code schema
00072                   -- MCM Not currently supported --
00073   ------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00074 
00075 /* Generate remainder loop code schema given the iteration variable
00076    increment operation */
00077 
00078 /*
00079    If original loop is of the form:
00080            Loop:  ~~~~~~~~~~
00081                   ~~~~~~~~~~
00082                   r100 = r100 + incr_reg
00083                   ble r100, max_reg
00084    generate:
00085            Preheader: ~~~~~~~~~
00086                       ~~~~~~~~~
00087                       r200 = num_increments * incr_reg
00088                       r201 = r200 + r100
00089            Prologue:  bgt r201, max_reg, Rem_loop
00090                       ~~~~~~~~~
00091                       ~~~~~~~~~
00092                       r300 = (unroll - 1) * incr_reg
00093                       new_max_reg = max_reg - r300
00094            Kernel:    ~~~~~~~~~
00095                       ~~~~~~~~~
00096                       ble r100, new_max_reg, Kernel
00097            Epilogue:  ~~~~~~~~~
00098                       ~~~~~~~~~
00099                       bgt r100, max, End
00100            Rem_loop:  same as original loop
00101            End:
00102 
00103 
00104    num_increments is the number of iterations initiated in the prologue and
00105    first iteration of the kernel minus 1. */
00106 
00107 void
00108 Lpipe_rem_loop_gen (L_Func * fn, L_Oper * loop_incr, 
00109                     int ii, int unroll, int stage_count)
00110 {
00111   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
00112   L_Oper *rem_loop_br;          /* loop back branch for the remainder loop */
00113   L_Operand *ind_var_src;       /* loop index variable */
00114   L_Operand *ind_incr_src;      /* increment operand for induction op */
00115   L_Operand *max_src;           /* loop bound source */
00116   L_Oper *oper;
00117   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
00118   int starting_copy;
00119   int last_copy;
00120   int pro_stage;
00121   int epi_stage;
00122   int i;
00123   int copy;
00124   L_Oper *first_oper;
00125   L_Oper *last_oper;
00126   int intra_iter_issue_time;
00127   L_Oper *new_oper;
00128   Softpipe_Op_Info *new_info;
00129   int num_increments;
00130   int total_increment;
00131   L_Oper *last_prologue_op;
00132 
00133   /* find prologue, epilogue, and remainder cb's */
00134   prologue_cb = header_cb->prev_cb;
00135   epilogue_cb = header_cb->next_cb;
00136   remainder_cb = epilogue_cb->next_cb;
00137   rem_loop_br = Lpipe_find_loop_back_br (fn, remainder_cb);
00138 
00139   /* fill in instructions that were inserted during phase 1 */
00140 
00141   /* find index variable and its increment operand */
00142   if (L_same_operand (loop_incr->dest[0], loop_incr->src[0]))
00143     {
00144       ind_var_src = loop_incr->src[0];
00145       ind_incr_src = loop_incr->src[1];
00146     }
00147   else
00148     {
00149       ind_var_src = loop_incr->src[1];
00150       ind_incr_src = loop_incr->src[0];
00151     }
00152 
00153   /* find loop bound */
00154   if (L_same_operand (ind_var_src, rem_loop_br->src[0]))
00155     {
00156       max_src = rem_loop_br->src[1];
00157     }
00158   else
00159     {
00160       max_src = rem_loop_br->src[0];
00161     }
00162 
00163   /* need to check whether there are at least as many iterations as will
00164      be initiated in the prologue and the first iteration of the kernel.
00165      stage count - 1 increments of index variable during prologue, unroll 
00166      increments during the first iteration of the kernel.  Subtract one to
00167      get the value of the induction variable used to determine if the
00168      iteration initiated in the last stage of the kernel will execute. */
00169 
00170   num_increments = stage_count + unroll - 2;
00171   if (L_is_register (ind_incr_src))
00172     {
00173       /* Need to multiply the number of increments by the increment operand.
00174          This multiplication is the 2nd to the last oper in preheader. */
00175       oper = preheader_cb->last_op->prev_op;
00176       /* src[0] is an integer constant equal to the number of increments */
00177       L_delete_operand (oper->src[0]);
00178       oper->src[0] = L_new_gen_int_operand (num_increments);
00179     }
00180   else
00181     {
00182       /* increment is a constant, so compiler can do the multiplication.
00183          The add is the last operation in preheader */
00184       oper = preheader_cb->last_op;
00185       L_delete_operand (oper->src[0]);
00186       /* src[0] is the total increment of the index variable */
00187       total_increment = num_increments * (int) ind_incr_src->value.i;
00188       oper->src[0] = L_new_gen_int_operand (total_increment);
00189     }
00190 
00191   /* Each iteration of the kernel, unroll iterations will be initiated.
00192      Subtract once from max rather than adding to induction variable 
00193      every iteration of kernel. */
00194   num_increments = unroll - 1;
00195   if (L_is_register (ind_incr_src))
00196     {
00197       /* Need to multiply the number of increments by the increment operand.
00198          This multiplication is the 2nd to the last oper in prologue. */
00199       oper = prologue_cb->last_op->prev_op;
00200       /* src[0] is an integer constant equal to the number of increments */
00201       L_delete_operand (oper->src[0]);
00202       oper->src[0] = L_new_gen_int_operand (num_increments);
00203     }
00204   else
00205     {
00206       if (L_is_register (max_src))
00207         {
00208           /* increment is a constant, so compiler can do the multiplication.
00209              The add is the last operation in prologue */
00210           oper = prologue_cb->last_op;
00211           L_delete_operand (oper->src[0]);
00212           /* src[0] is the total increment of the index variable */
00213           total_increment = num_increments * (int) ind_incr_src->value.i;
00214           /* negate total_increment to do subtract */
00215           oper->src[0] = L_new_gen_int_operand (-total_increment);
00216         }
00217       else
00218         {
00219           /* Total increment is moved to a register and then subtracted
00220              from the constant max.  The move operation is the 2nd to last
00221              in prologue */
00222           oper = prologue_cb->last_op->prev_op;
00223           L_delete_operand (oper->src[0]);
00224           total_increment = num_increments * (int) ind_incr_src->value.i;
00225           oper->src[0] = L_new_gen_int_operand (total_increment);
00226         }
00227     }
00228 
00229   /* Generate the stages of the prologue from last to first.
00230      Last stage of the prologue is stage_count - 2.  This should be a copy of
00231      kernel_copy[unroll - 1] with instructions from the last stage deleted.
00232      Each preceding stage of the prologue will use the preceding kernel
00233      copy modulo unroll.  There will be less than stage_count stages in the
00234      prologue.  (stage_count / unroll + 1) is a ceiling on the number of
00235      copies of the unrolled kernel needed to make the prologue (note that
00236      stage_count does not have to be a multiple of unroll).
00237      (stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll is an upper bound on the number of
00238      kernel stages that need to be copied.  This number modulo unroll is 0.
00239      ((stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll - 1) modulo unroll gives unroll-1.
00240      Thus, starting_copy modulo unroll gives the kernel copy needed for the
00241      last stage of the prologue. The second to the last stage of the prologue
00242      is copied from kernel_copy[(starting_copy - 1) mod unroll)] and so on.
00243      Since starting_copy is an upper bound on the number of kernel stages 
00244      that need to be copied, i below will remain positive for until all
00245      stages of the prologue have been generated. */
00246 
00247   last_prologue_op = prologue_cb->last_op;
00248   starting_copy = (stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll - 1;
00249   last_copy = starting_copy - (stage_count - 2);
00250   pro_stage = stage_count - 2;
00251   for (i = starting_copy; i >= last_copy; i--)
00252     {
00253       copy = i % unroll;
00254       first_oper = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
00255       last_oper = kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
00256       for (oper = last_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->prev_op)
00257         {
00258           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00259             {
00260               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00261               intra_iter_issue_time = softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time;
00262               /* At stage x of prologue, instructions from stage x+1 of the
00263                  pipeline are not executed (the first iteration has not 
00264                  progressed that far yet).  The first instruction of stage x+1
00265                  has intra-iteration issue time (x+1)*ii.  Also, don't copy
00266                  loop back branches to prologue. */
00267               if ((intra_iter_issue_time < (pro_stage + 1) * ii) &&
00268                   (!L_int_cond_branch_opcode (oper)))
00269                 {
00270                   new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00271                   new_oper->ext =
00272                     (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
00273                   new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
00274                   new_info->kernel_copy = copy;
00275                   new_info->prologue_stage = pro_stage;
00276                   /* issue time relative to beginning of prologue */
00277                   new_info->issue_time = pro_stage * ii +
00278                     intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
00279                   L_insert_oper_after (prologue_cb, last_prologue_op,
00280                                        new_oper);
00281                 }
00282               if (oper == first_oper)
00283                 break;
00284             }
00285         }
00286       pro_stage = pro_stage - 1;
00287     }
00288 
00289   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_prologue ();
00290 
00291   /* Generate the stages of the epilogue from first to last.
00292      First stage of the epilogue is stage 0.  This should be a copy
00293      of kernel_copy[0] with instructions from the first stage deleted.
00294      Each succeeding stage of the prologue will use the succeeding kernel
00295      copy modulo unroll.  */
00296   epi_stage = 1;
00297   for (i = 0; i < stage_count - 1; i++)
00298     {
00299       copy = i % unroll;
00300       first_oper = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
00301       last_oper = kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
00302       for (oper = first_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
00303         {
00304           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00305             {
00306               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00307               intra_iter_issue_time = softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time;
00308               /* At stage x of epilogue, instructions from stage x-1 of 
00309                  the final iteration are already executed.  Therefore 
00310                  only instructions from stage x or later of the pipeline 
00311                  are included. The first instruction of stage x has 
00312                  intra-iteration issue time x*ii.  Also, don't copy loop 
00313                  back branches to epilogue. */
00314               if ((intra_iter_issue_time >= epi_stage * ii) &&
00315                   (!L_int_cond_branch_opcode (oper)))
00316                 {
00317                   new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00318                   new_oper->ext =
00319                     (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
00320                   new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
00321                   /* issue time relative to beginning of epilogue */
00322                   new_info->issue_time = (epi_stage - 1) * ii +
00323                     intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
00324                   new_info->kernel_copy = copy;
00325                   new_info->epilogue_stage = epi_stage;
00326                   L_insert_oper_before (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op,
00327                                         new_oper);
00328                 }
00329               if (oper == last_oper)
00330                 break;
00331             }
00332         }
00333       epi_stage = epi_stage + 1;
00334     }
00335 
00336   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_epilogue (epilogue_cb);
00337 }
00338 
00339 
00340 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------
00341                      Muliple epilogue code schema
00342   ------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00343 
00344 /* Generate an epilogue for an exit branch from the kernel. */
00345 
00346 static void
00347 Lpipe_gen_epi (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * header_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch,
00348                L_Cb * fall_thru_cb, int epi_type, int ii, int unroll,
00349                int stage_count)
00350 {
00351   double epi_weight;            /* weight of epilogue cb */
00352   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
00353   L_Cb *exit_cb = NULL;
00354   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_branch_info;
00355   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
00356   L_Attr *attr;
00357   L_Oper *new_oper;
00358 
00359   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
00360 
00361   /* Create epilogue cb and add it to control flow graph.  The last 
00362      epilogue cb created is placed the closest to the kernel cb. */
00363   epi_weight = exit_branch_info->exit_weight / unroll;
00364   epilogue_cb = L_create_cb (epi_weight);
00365   attr = L_new_attr ("epilogue", 0);
00366   epilogue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, attr);
00367 
00368   L_insert_cb_after (fn, header_cb, epilogue_cb);
00369 
00370   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
00371     epilogue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (epilogue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
00372 
00373   {
00374     /*
00375      * FLOW MANIPULATION
00376      * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00377      */
00378     L_Flow *new_flow = NULL;
00379     int cc;
00380 
00381     /* kernel to epilogue flows */
00382     if (epi_type == FALL_THRU_EPI)
00383       {
00384         new_flow = L_new_flow (0, header_cb, epilogue_cb, epi_weight);
00385         header_cb->dest_flow = L_concat_flow (header_cb->dest_flow, new_flow);
00386         exit_cb = fall_thru_cb;
00387       }
00388     else if (epi_type == TARGET_EPI)
00389       {
00390         new_flow = L_new_flow (1, header_cb, epilogue_cb, epi_weight);
00391         header_cb->dest_flow = L_insert_flow_before (header_cb->dest_flow,
00392                                                      header_cb->dest_flow,
00393                                                      new_flow);
00394         exit_cb = L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
00395         L_change_branch_dest (exit_branch, exit_cb, epilogue_cb);
00396       }
00397     else
00398       {
00399         L_punt ("gen_epi: Unsupported epi_type");
00400       }
00401 
00402     epilogue_cb->src_flow = L_copy_single_flow (new_flow);
00403 
00404     /* epilogue to exit cb flows */
00405 
00406     cc = (epilogue_cb->next_cb != exit_cb);
00407     epilogue_cb->dest_flow =
00408       L_new_flow (cc, epilogue_cb, exit_cb, epi_weight);
00409     new_flow = L_new_flow (cc, epilogue_cb, exit_cb, epi_weight);
00410 
00411     exit_cb->src_flow = L_insert_flow_before (exit_cb->src_flow,
00412                                               exit_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
00413   }
00414   {
00415     /*
00416      * OPER COPYING
00417      * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00418      */
00419     int theta;                  /* intra-iter stage with exit branch         */
00420     int epi_stage;              /* current epilogue stage number             */
00421     int iter_stage;             /* stage of the iter which contains oper     */
00422     int copy;                   /* copy of kernel which contains exit branch */
00423     int unrolled_iter_num;      /* Number to identify the current
00424                                    copy of the whole unrolled kernel.
00425                                    Copy numbers are positive numbers 
00426                                    starting with 1. */
00427 
00428     L_Oper *first_oper, *last_oper, *oper;
00429     L_Flow *new_flow;
00430     Softpipe_Op_Info *new_info;
00431     L_Cb *dest_cb;
00432 
00433     /* Generate the stages of the epilogue from first to last.  The 
00434        first stage of the epilogue is called stage 0.  Epilogue stage 0 is for
00435        the opers remaining in same kernel copy as the exit branch.  The number
00436        of stages in the epilogue is reduced by theta.  Start copying 
00437        from the kernel copy which contains the exit branch and wrap around 
00438        the kernel until all epilogue stages are generated. */
00439 
00440     theta = exit_branch_info->stage;
00441     copy = exit_branch_info->kernel_copy - 1;
00442     unrolled_iter_num = 1;
00443     for (epi_stage = 0; epi_stage < stage_count - theta; epi_stage++)
00444       {
00445         copy = (copy + 1) % unroll;
00446 
00447         last_oper = kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
00448 
00449         if (epi_stage == 0)
00450           {
00451             /* if exit branch is the last oper in stage - i.e., a copy of the
00452                loop back branch, there will be no opers in epilogue stage 0 */
00453             if (exit_branch == last_oper)
00454               continue;
00455             first_oper = exit_branch->next_op;
00456           }
00457         else
00458           {
00459             first_oper = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
00460           }
00461 
00462         /* if starting to copy from the beginning of the unrolled kernel and
00463          * the epilogue already contains opers from a previous major iteration
00464          * of the unrolled kernel, update the number for the "iter" attibute. 
00465          */
00466         if ((copy == 0) && (epilogue_cb->first_op != NULL))
00467           unrolled_iter_num++;
00468 
00469         for (oper = first_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
00470           {
00471             if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00472               {
00473                 softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00474                 iter_stage = softpipe_info->stage;
00475 
00476                 /* At stage x of epilog, instructions from stage x-1+theta of 
00477                  * the final iteration are already executed.  Therefore only 
00478                  * instructions from stage x+theta or later of the iteration 
00479                  * are included.
00480                  * This effectively excludes instructions from iterations after
00481                  * the final iteration since those iterations are executing in 
00482                  * earlier stages.  If the oper is from the final iteration,
00483                  * only copy if it was originally above the branch in the 
00484                  * original loop body. 
00485                  */
00486 
00487                 if ((iter_stage > (epi_stage + theta))
00488                     || ((iter_stage == (epi_stage + theta)) &&
00489                         (softpipe_info->home_block <=
00490                          exit_branch_info->home_block)))
00491                   {
00492                     new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00493                     new_oper->ext =
00494                       (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
00495                     new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
00496                     /* issue time relative to beginning of epilogue */
00497                     new_info->issue_time = epi_stage * ii +
00498                       softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
00499                     new_info->kernel_copy = copy;
00500                     new_info->epilogue_stage = epi_stage;
00501                     new_info->unrolled_iter_num = unrolled_iter_num;
00502                     attr = L_new_attr ("unrolled_iter", 1);
00503                     L_set_int_attr_field (attr, 0, unrolled_iter_num);
00504                     new_oper->attr = L_concat_attr (new_oper->attr, attr);
00505                     L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op,
00506                                          new_oper);
00507                     if (L_cond_branch (oper))
00508                       {
00509                         dest_cb = L_find_branch_dest (oper);
00510                         new_flow = L_new_flow (1, epilogue_cb, dest_cb,
00511                                                UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
00512                         epilogue_cb->dest_flow =
00513                           L_concat_flow (epilogue_cb->dest_flow, new_flow);
00514                         new_flow = L_copy_single_flow (new_flow);
00515                         dest_cb->src_flow =
00516                           L_concat_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
00517                       }
00518                   }
00519                 if (oper == last_oper)
00520                   break;
00521               }
00522           }
00523       }
00524   }
00525 
00526   /* add jump to fall through cb */
00527   if (epilogue_cb->next_cb != exit_cb)
00528     {
00529       new_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_JUMP);
00530       new_oper->src[0] = L_new_cb_operand (exit_cb);
00531       L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
00532       L_annotate_oper (fn, epilogue_cb, new_oper);
00533       L_delete_oper (epilogue_cb, new_oper);
00534     }
00535 
00536   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_epilogue (epilogue_cb);
00537   return;
00538 }
00539 
00540 
00541 /* Find the corresponding copy of exit_branch in the kernel copy defined
00542    by first_oper and last_oper */
00543 L_Oper *
00544 Lpipe_find_exit_branch_copy (L_Oper * exit_branch, L_Oper * first_oper,
00545                              L_Oper * last_oper)
00546 {
00547   L_Oper *oper;
00548   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
00549   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_branch_info;
00550 
00551   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
00552 
00553   for (oper = first_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
00554     {
00555       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00556         {
00557           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00558           if (softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time ==
00559               exit_branch_info->intra_iter_issue_time)
00560             {
00561               if (softpipe_info->issue_slot == exit_branch_info->issue_slot)
00562                 {
00563                   return (oper);
00564                 }
00565             }
00566           if (oper == last_oper)
00567             {
00568               L_punt ("Lpipe_find_exit_branch_copy: "
00569                       "Copy of exit branch not found.\n");
00570             }
00571         }
00572     }
00573 
00574   return 0;
00575 }
00576 
00577 
00578 /* Generate an epilogue for an exit branch from the prologue.  Place all
00579    partial epilogues at the end of the function. */
00580 static void
00581 Lpipe_gen_partial_epi (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * header_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch,
00582                        L_Cb * fall_thru_cb, int ii, int unroll, int stage_count)
00583 {
00584   L_Cb *epilogue_cb, *exit_cb, *dest_cb;
00585   L_Flow *new_flow;
00586   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_branch_info;
00587   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
00588   int copy;                     /* copy of kernel from which the prolog 
00589                                    code which contains the exit branch 
00590                                    was copied */
00591   int pro_stage;                /* stage of prologue which 
00592                                    contains exit branch */
00593   int epi_stage;                /* current epilogue stage number */
00594   int iter_stage;               /* stage of the iter which contains oper */
00595   L_Oper *first_oper;
00596   L_Oper *last_oper;
00597   L_Oper *oper;
00598   L_Oper *new_oper;
00599   Softpipe_Op_Info *new_info;
00600   L_Attr *attr;
00601   int unrolled_iter_num;        /* Number to identify the current
00602                                    copy of the whole unrolled kernel.
00603                                    Copy numbers are positive numbers
00604                                    starting with 1. */
00605   int theta;                    /* intra-iter stage containing exit branch */
00606   L_Oper *exit_branch_copy;     /* corresponding copy of prologue exit branch
00607                                    in kernel */
00608 
00609   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
00610 
00611   /* Create epilogue cb and add it to control flow graph.  The 
00612      epilogue cbs for exits from the prologue are placed at the end
00613      of the function because it is assumed that most of the time the
00614      kernel will be entered. */
00615   epilogue_cb = L_create_cb (UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
00616   L_insert_cb_after (fn, fn->last_cb, epilogue_cb);
00617   attr = L_new_attr ("epilogue", 0);
00618   epilogue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, attr);
00619 
00620   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
00621     epilogue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (epilogue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
00622 
00623   /* prologue to epilogue flows */
00624   new_flow = L_new_flow (1, prologue_cb, epilogue_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
00625   prologue_cb->dest_flow = L_insert_flow_before (prologue_cb->dest_flow,
00626                                                  prologue_cb->dest_flow,
00627                                                  new_flow);
00628   epilogue_cb->src_flow = L_copy_single_flow (new_flow);
00629 
00630   /* find exit cb */
00631 
00632   exit_cb = L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
00633 
00634   /* epilogue to exit cb flows */
00635   epilogue_cb->dest_flow =
00636     L_new_flow (1, epilogue_cb, exit_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
00637   new_flow = L_new_flow (1, epilogue_cb, exit_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
00638   exit_cb->src_flow = L_insert_flow_before (exit_cb->src_flow,
00639                                             exit_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
00640 
00641   L_change_branch_dest (exit_branch, L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch),
00642                         epilogue_cb);
00643 
00644 
00645   /* Generate the stages of the epilogue from first to last.  The
00646      first stage of the epilogue is called stage 0.  Epilogue stage 0 is for
00647      the opers remaining in same kernel copy as the exit branch.  The number
00648      of stages in the epilogue is reduced by theta.  Start copying
00649      from the kernel copy which contains the exit branch and wrap around
00650      the kernel until all epilogue stages are generated. */
00651   theta = exit_branch_info->stage;
00652   pro_stage = exit_branch_info->prologue_stage;
00653   copy = exit_branch_info->kernel_copy - 1;
00654   unrolled_iter_num = 1;
00655   for (epi_stage = 0; epi_stage < stage_count - theta; epi_stage++)
00656     {
00657       copy = (copy + 1) % unroll;
00658 
00659       first_oper = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
00660       last_oper = kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
00661       if (epi_stage == 0)
00662         {
00663           exit_branch_copy =
00664             Lpipe_find_exit_branch_copy (exit_branch, first_oper, last_oper);
00665           /* if exit branch is the last oper in stage - i.e., a copy of the
00666              loop back branch, there will be no opers in epilogue stage 0 */
00667           if (exit_branch_copy == last_oper)
00668             continue;
00669           first_oper = exit_branch_copy->next_op;
00670         }
00671 
00672       /* if starting to copy from the beginning of the unrolled kernel and
00673          the epilogue already contains opers from a previous major iteration
00674          of the unrolled kernel, update the number for the "iter" attibute. */
00675       if ((copy == 0) && (epilogue_cb->first_op != NULL))
00676         unrolled_iter_num++;
00677 
00678       for (oper = first_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
00679         {
00680           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00681             {
00682               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00683               iter_stage = softpipe_info->stage;
00684 
00685               /* At stage x of epilogue, instructions from stage x-1+theta 
00686                  of the final iteration are already executed.  Therefore 
00687                  only instructions from stage x+theta or later of the 
00688                  pipeline are included.  This effectively excludes 
00689                  instructions from iterations after the final iteration 
00690                  since those iterations are executing in earlier stages.  
00691                  If the oper is from the final iteration, only copy if it 
00692                  was originally above the branch in the original loop body. 
00693 
00694                  In the prologue, execution of the pipeline is ramping up so,
00695                  if an exit branch is taken, there are not as many iterations
00696                  that need to be finished up as in the kernel.  Therefore
00697                  don't copy instructions from any stage later than the
00698                  stage that the first iteration is currently executing.  For
00699                  an exit from prologue stage pro_stage and during epilogue
00700                  stage epi_stage, the first iteration is executing stage
00701                  pro_stage + epi_stage.  */
00702 
00703 
00704               if (((iter_stage > (epi_stage + theta)) ||
00705                    (iter_stage == (epi_stage + theta) &&
00706                     softpipe_info->home_block <=
00707                     exit_branch_info->home_block))
00708                   && (iter_stage <= (pro_stage + epi_stage)))
00709                 {
00710                   new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00711                   new_oper->ext =
00712                     (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
00713                   new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
00714                   /* issue time relative to beginning of epilogue */
00715                   new_info->issue_time = epi_stage * ii +
00716                     softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
00717                   new_info->kernel_copy = copy;
00718                   new_info->epilogue_stage = epi_stage;
00719                   new_info->unrolled_iter_num = unrolled_iter_num;
00720                   attr = L_new_attr ("unrolled_iter", 1);
00721                   L_set_int_attr_field (attr, 0, unrolled_iter_num);
00722                   new_oper->attr = L_concat_attr (new_oper->attr, attr);
00723                   L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op,
00724                                        new_oper);
00725                   if (L_cond_branch (oper))
00726                     {
00727                       dest_cb = L_find_branch_dest (oper);
00728                       new_flow = L_new_flow (1, epilogue_cb, dest_cb,
00729                                              UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
00730                       epilogue_cb->dest_flow =
00731                         L_concat_flow (epilogue_cb->dest_flow, new_flow);
00732                       new_flow = L_copy_single_flow (new_flow);
00733                       dest_cb->src_flow =
00734                         L_concat_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
00735                     }
00736                 }
00737               if (oper == last_oper)
00738                 break;
00739             }
00740         }
00741     }
00742   /* add jump to fall through cb */
00743   if (epilogue_cb->next_cb != exit_cb)
00744     {
00745       new_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_JUMP);
00746       new_oper->src[0] = L_new_cb_operand (exit_cb);
00747       L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
00748       L_annotate_oper (fn, epilogue_cb, new_oper);
00749       L_delete_oper (epilogue_cb, new_oper);
00750     }
00751 
00752   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_epilogue (epilogue_cb);
00753 }
00754 
00755 extern void M_starcore_negate_compare (L_Oper *);
00756 
00757 /* generate multiple epilogues */
00758 void
00759 Lpipe_multi_epi_gen (L_Func * fn, int stage_count, L_Oper * loop_back_br,
00760                      int ii, int unroll)
00761 {
00762   L_Oper *oper;
00763   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
00764 
00765   int starting_copy;
00766   int last_copy;
00767   int pro_stage;
00768   int i;
00769   int copy;
00770   L_Oper *first_oper, *last_oper, *prev_oper;
00771   int iter_stage;
00772   L_Oper *new_oper;
00773   Softpipe_Op_Info *new_info;
00774 
00775   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
00776   L_Cb *dest_cb;
00777 
00778   L_Flow *flow;
00779   L_Flow *new_flow;
00780   L_Flow *src_flow;
00781   L_Flow *next_flow;
00782 
00783   L_Flow *fall_thru_flow;       /* flow for fall thru path of loop back br. */
00784   L_Cb *fall_thru_cb;           /* cb in fall thru path of loop back branch */
00785 
00786   L_Flow *loop_back_flow;       /* taken flow of loop back branch */
00787   double loop_back_weight;      /* weight of loop_back_flow */
00788 
00789   L_Attr *attr;
00790   int num_unrolled_kernel_iters;        /* Number of different copies of the
00791                                            unrolled kernel that appear in the
00792                                            prologue (in whole or in part). */
00793   int unrolled_iter_num;        /* Number to identify the current
00794                                    copy of the unrolled kernel. 
00795                                    Copies are numbered 1 to 
00796                                    num_unrolled_kernel_iters. */
00797 
00798   /*
00799    * PROFILE INFORMATION UPDATE
00800    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00801    */
00802 
00803   loop_back_flow = L_find_flow_with_dst_cb (header_cb->dest_flow, header_cb);
00804   src_flow = L_find_matching_flow (header_cb->src_flow, loop_back_flow);
00805   loop_back_weight = loop_back_flow->weight / unroll;
00806   L_change_flow (loop_back_flow, 1, header_cb, header_cb, loop_back_weight);
00807   L_change_flow (src_flow, 1, header_cb, header_cb, loop_back_weight);
00808   header_cb->weight -= loop_back_weight * (unroll - 1);
00809 
00810   /*
00811    * PROLOGUE GENERATION
00812    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00813    */
00814 
00815   /* There is guaranteed to be a single preheader cb that flows
00816      into the loop header.  The preheader is created */
00817 
00818   prologue_cb = L_create_cb (preheader_cb->dest_flow->weight);
00819   L_insert_cb_before (fn, header_cb, prologue_cb);
00820   attr = L_new_attr ("prologue", 0);
00821   prologue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (prologue_cb->attr, attr);
00822 
00823   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
00824     prologue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (prologue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
00825 
00826   /* preheader to prologue flows */
00827   if (preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb != header_cb)
00828     L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: dest cb for preheader flow is not header:"
00829             " preheader_cb is %d, header_cb is %d, dest of flow is %d\n",
00830             preheader_cb->id, header_cb->id,
00831             preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb->id);
00832 
00833   preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb = prologue_cb;
00834   prologue_cb->src_flow = L_new_flow (preheader_cb->dest_flow->cc,
00835                                       preheader_cb, prologue_cb,
00836                                       prologue_cb->weight);
00837 
00838   /* Prologue to header flows.  Assume only flows into header cb are
00839      from preheader and loop back branch */
00840 
00841   flow = header_cb->src_flow;
00842   if (flow->src_cb == header_cb)
00843     flow = flow->next_flow;
00844   flow->src_cb = prologue_cb;
00845 
00846   prologue_cb->dest_flow = L_new_flow (flow->cc, prologue_cb, header_cb,
00847                                        prologue_cb->weight);
00848 
00849   /* 
00850    * Generate the stages of the prologue from last to first.  The stages
00851    * of the prologue are numbered 0 through stage_count-2.  The last
00852    * stage of the prologue should be a copy of kernel_copy[unroll - 1] with 
00853    * instructions from the last intra-iteration stage deleted.  Each 
00854    * preceding stage of the prologue is copied from the preceding 
00855    * kernel copy modulo unroll.   The number of stages in the prologue
00856    * may be larger than the degree of unrolling of the kernel, so as
00857    * the copy number is decremented, it may become negative, producing
00858    * and invalid copy number.  So, we start copying using a copy number 
00859    * which is at least as large as the number of stages in the prologue
00860    * and which, modulo unroll, is equal to unroll-1.
00861    *
00862    * There are fewer than stage_count stages in the prologue, so
00863    * (stage_count / unroll + 1) is an upper bound on the number 
00864    * of copies of the unrolled kernel needed to make the prologue (note that
00865    * stage_count does not have to be a multiple of unroll).
00866    * (stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll is an upper bound on the number of
00867    * kernel stages that need to be copied.  This number modulo unroll is 0.
00868    * ((stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll - 1) modulo unroll gives 
00869    * unroll - 1.  Thus, starting_copy modulo unroll gives the kernel 
00870    * copy needed for the last stage of the prologue.  The second to the 
00871    * last stage of the prologue is copied from 
00872    * kernel_copy[(starting_copy - 1) mod unroll)] and so on.
00873    * Since starting_copy is an upper bound on the number of kernel stages 
00874    * that need to be copied, i below will remain positive until all
00875    * stages of the prologue have been generated. 
00876    */
00877 
00878   starting_copy = (stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll - 1;
00879   last_copy = starting_copy - (stage_count - 2);
00880   pro_stage = stage_count - 2;
00881   num_unrolled_kernel_iters = (stage_count - 1) / unroll;
00882   if (((stage_count - 1) % unroll) != 0)
00883     num_unrolled_kernel_iters++;
00884 
00885   unrolled_iter_num = num_unrolled_kernel_iters + 1;
00886   for (i = starting_copy; i >= last_copy; i--)
00887     {
00888       copy = i % unroll;
00889       first_oper = kernel_copy_first_op[copy];
00890       last_oper = kernel_copy_last_op[copy];
00891       if (copy == (unroll - 1))
00892         unrolled_iter_num--;
00893       for (oper = last_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->prev_op)
00894         {
00895           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00896             {
00897               /* will break out of this loop after copying first_oper */
00898 
00899               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
00900               iter_stage = softpipe_info->stage;
00901 
00902               /* At stage x of prologue, instructions from stage x+1 of the
00903                  pipeline (and later) are not executed (the first iteration 
00904                  has not progressed that far yet). */
00905               if (iter_stage <= pro_stage)
00906                 {
00907                   new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
00908                   new_oper->ext =
00909                     (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
00910                   new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
00911                   new_info->kernel_copy = copy;
00912                   new_info->prologue_stage = pro_stage;
00913                   /* issue time relative to beginning of prologue */
00914                   new_info->issue_time = pro_stage * ii +
00915                     softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
00916                   new_info->unrolled_iter_num = unrolled_iter_num;
00917                   attr = L_new_attr ("unrolled_iter", 1);
00918                   L_set_int_attr_field (attr, 0, unrolled_iter_num);
00919                   new_oper->attr = L_concat_attr (new_oper->attr, attr);
00920                   L_insert_oper_before (prologue_cb, prologue_cb->first_op,
00921                                         new_oper);
00922 #if 0
00923                   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (new_oper->flags, L_OPER_SPECULATIVE))
00924                     {
00925                       attr = L_new_attr ("L_OPER_SPECULATIVE", 0);
00926                       new_oper->attr = L_concat_attr (new_oper->attr, attr);
00927                     }
00928 #endif
00929                 }
00930               if (oper == first_oper)
00931                 break;
00932             }
00933         }
00934       pro_stage = pro_stage - 1;
00935     }
00936 
00937   /* adjust sync arcs after prologue generation */
00938   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_prologue ();
00939 
00940   /*
00941    * EPILOGUES FOR KERNEL SIDE EXITS
00942    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
00943    */
00944 
00945   /* find fall through cb of original loop */
00946   fall_thru_flow = loop_back_flow->next_flow;
00947 
00948   /* delete flows corresponding to every branch in the original loop except
00949    * the loop back branch 
00950    */
00951 
00952   for (flow = header_cb->dest_flow; flow != loop_back_flow; flow = next_flow)
00953     {
00954       next_flow = flow->next_flow;
00955       dest_cb = flow->dst_cb;
00956       src_flow = L_find_matching_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, flow);
00957       dest_cb->src_flow = L_delete_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, src_flow);
00958       header_cb->dest_flow = L_delete_flow (header_cb->dest_flow, flow);
00959     }
00960 
00961   if (fall_thru_flow)
00962     {
00963       /* delete flow from header cb to fall through cb since all exits from
00964        * header will go to epilogues 
00965        */
00966 
00967       fall_thru_cb = fall_thru_flow->dst_cb;
00968 
00969       src_flow = L_find_matching_flow (fall_thru_cb->src_flow,
00970                                        fall_thru_flow);
00971 
00972       fall_thru_cb->src_flow = L_delete_flow (fall_thru_cb->src_flow,
00973                                               src_flow);
00974 
00975       header_cb->dest_flow = L_delete_flow (header_cb->dest_flow,
00976                                             fall_thru_flow);
00977     }
00978   else
00979     {
00980       fall_thru_cb = NULL;
00981     }
00982 
00983   /* Generate multiple epilogues from the second to last branch in the
00984    * kernel to the first branch.  Generate the epilogues in this order
00985    * to make it easy to insert the flows into the header cb. 
00986    * Each new epilogue is inserted right after
00987    * the kernel, so the last epilogue generated is laid out the closest
00988    * to the kernel.  Generate the epilogue for the loop back
00989    * branch last because the kernel reaches this epilogue by falling
00990    * through the loop back branch. 
00991    */
00992 
00993   last_oper = header_cb->last_op;
00994   for (prev_oper = last_oper->prev_op, oper = prev_oper;
00995        oper != NULL; oper = prev_oper)
00996     {
00997       if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
00998         {
00999           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01000           prev_oper = oper->prev_op;
01001 
01002           if (L_cond_branch (oper))
01003             {
01004               if (softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
01005                 {
01006                   if (!fall_thru_cb)
01007                     L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: cond branch loopback "
01008                             "with no FT flow");
01009                   if (M_arch != M_STARCORE)
01010                     L_negate_compare (oper);
01011                   else
01012                     M_starcore_negate_compare (oper);
01013 
01014                   L_change_branch_dest (oper,
01015                                         L_find_branch_dest (oper),
01016                                         fall_thru_cb);
01017                 }
01018               Lpipe_gen_epi (fn, header_cb, oper, fall_thru_cb,
01019                              TARGET_EPI, ii, unroll, stage_count);
01020             }
01021           else if (L_uncond_branch (oper))
01022             {
01023               if (softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
01024                 {
01025                   /* if loop ends with unconditional jump, copies of this 
01026                    * branch always fall through. No epilogue is generated, 
01027                    * and the extraneous jump is removed.
01028                    */
01029                   kernel_copy_last_op[SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper)->kernel_copy] =
01030                     prev_oper;
01031                   oper->ext = 0;
01032                   L_delete_oper (header_cb, oper);
01033                 }
01034               else
01035                 L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: Unexpected uncond branch");
01036             }
01037         }
01038     }
01039 
01040   /*
01041    * EPILOGUE FOR FALL-THROUGH PATH
01042    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01043    */
01044 
01045   if (L_cond_branch (last_oper))
01046     Lpipe_gen_epi (fn, header_cb, last_oper, fall_thru_cb,
01047                    FALL_THRU_EPI, ii, unroll, stage_count);
01048 
01049   /*
01050    * EPILOGUES FOR PROLOGUE EXITS
01051    * ----------------------------------------------------------------------
01052    * Prologue may be empty if stage_count == 1
01053    */
01054 
01055   last_oper = prologue_cb->last_op;
01056   if (last_oper == NULL)
01057     {
01058       if (stage_count > 1)
01059         L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: stage count is greater than 1, "
01060                 "but prologue is empty.  cb = %d\n", header_cb->id);
01061     }
01062   else
01063     {
01064       /* Epilogue for last branch in prologue may be the same as for last 
01065          branch in kernel. */
01066       softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (last_oper);
01067       if (softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
01068         {
01069           if (L_cond_branch (last_oper))
01070             {
01071               epilogue_cb = header_cb->next_cb;
01072               /* change condition of branch so it is now taken when it used to 
01073                  fall thru and change target of branch */
01074 
01075               L_negate_compare (last_oper);
01076               L_change_branch_dest (last_oper, L_find_branch_dest (last_oper),
01077                                     epilogue_cb);
01078 
01079               /* prologue to epilogue flows */
01080               new_flow = L_new_flow (1, prologue_cb, epilogue_cb,
01081                                      UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01082               prologue_cb->dest_flow =
01083                 L_insert_flow_before (prologue_cb->dest_flow,
01084                                       prologue_cb->dest_flow, new_flow);
01085               new_flow = L_new_flow (1, prologue_cb, epilogue_cb,
01086                                      UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01087               epilogue_cb->src_flow =
01088                 L_insert_flow_before (epilogue_cb->src_flow,
01089                                       epilogue_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
01090               last_oper = last_oper->prev_op;
01091             }
01092           else if (L_uncond_branch (last_oper))
01093             {
01094               oper->ext = 0;
01095               L_delete_oper (prologue_cb, oper);
01096               last_oper = prologue_cb->last_op;
01097             }
01098         }
01099 
01100       /* Generate partial epilogues for other exits from prologue.  Go from
01101          last branch to first branch.  Place all partial epilogues at the
01102          end of the function.  */
01103       for (oper = last_oper; oper != NULL; oper = prev_oper)
01104         {
01105           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
01106             {
01107               prev_oper = oper->prev_op;
01108               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01109 
01110               if (L_cond_branch (oper))
01111                 {
01112                   if (softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
01113                     {
01114                       if (!fall_thru_cb)
01115                         L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: cond branch loopback "
01116                                 "with no FT flow");
01117                       L_negate_compare (oper);
01118                       L_change_branch_dest (oper,
01119                                             L_find_branch_dest (oper),
01120                                             fall_thru_cb);
01121                     }
01122                   Lpipe_gen_partial_epi (fn, prologue_cb, oper, fall_thru_cb,
01123                                          ii, unroll, stage_count);
01124                 }
01125               else if (L_uncond_branch (oper))
01126                 {
01127                   if (softpipe_info->loop_back_br)
01128                     {
01129                       /* loop ends with unconditional jump, copies of this
01130                        * branch always fall through. No epilogue is 
01131                        * generated, and the extraneous jump is removed.
01132                        */
01133                       oper->ext = 0;
01134                       L_delete_oper (prologue_cb, oper);
01135                     }
01136                   else
01137                     L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: Unexpected uncond branch");
01138                 }
01139             }
01140         }
01141     }
01142   return;
01143 }
01144 
01145 
01146 static void
01147 Lpipe_remove_comp_code_block (L_Cb * ssa_cb)
01148 {
01149   L_Cb *exit_cb, *epi_cb;
01150   L_Flow *src_flow, *exit_flow, *epi_flow, *new_flow;
01151 
01152   exit_cb = ssa_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb;
01153 
01154   /* delete src flow for exit cb */
01155   exit_flow = L_find_matching_flow (exit_cb->src_flow, ssa_cb->dest_flow);
01156   exit_cb->src_flow = L_delete_flow (exit_cb->src_flow, exit_flow);
01157 
01158   /* Update dest flow for each epilogue that jumps to compensation code
01159      cb.  Add corresponding src flow to exit cb.  Change destination
01160      of jump in epilogue. */
01161   for (src_flow = ssa_cb->src_flow; src_flow != NULL;
01162        src_flow = src_flow->next_flow)
01163     {
01164 
01165       epi_cb = src_flow->src_cb;
01166       epi_flow = epi_cb->dest_flow;
01167       L_change_flow (epi_flow, 1, epi_cb, exit_cb, epi_flow->weight);
01168       new_flow = L_copy_single_flow (epi_flow);
01169       exit_cb->src_flow = L_insert_flow_before (exit_cb->src_flow,
01170                                                 exit_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
01171       L_change_branch_dest (epi_cb->last_op,
01172                             L_find_branch_dest (epi_cb->last_op), exit_cb);
01173     }
01174 
01175   L_delete_cb (L_fn, ssa_cb);
01176 }
01177 
01178 
01179 static void
01180 Lpipe_remove_epilogue (L_Func * fn, L_Oper * exit, L_Cb * pipe_cb,
01181                        L_Cb * epilogue_cb, L_Cb * fall_thru_cb, int epi_type)
01182 {
01183   L_Flow *flow;
01184   int cc;
01185 
01186   if (epi_type == TARGET_EPI)
01187     {
01188       L_change_branch_dest (exit, L_find_branch_dest (exit), fall_thru_cb);
01189       flow = L_find_flow_for_branch (pipe_cb, exit);
01190       cc = 1;
01191     }
01192   else
01193     {
01194       flow = L_find_last_flow (pipe_cb->dest_flow);
01195       cc = 0;
01196     }
01197 
01198   L_change_flow (flow, cc, pipe_cb, fall_thru_cb, flow->weight);
01199   flow = L_find_flow_with_src_cb (fall_thru_cb->src_flow, epilogue_cb);
01200   L_change_flow (flow, cc, pipe_cb, fall_thru_cb, flow->weight);
01201   L_delete_cb (fn, epilogue_cb);
01202 }
01203 
01204 
01205 void
01206 Lpipe_remove_empty_epilogues (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * header_cb)
01207 {
01208   L_Oper *oper;
01209   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
01210   L_Cb *fall_thru_cb = NULL;
01211   int empty_epilogue;
01212   L_Oper *last_oper;
01213   L_Cb *dest_cb;
01214 
01215   for (oper = prologue_cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
01216     {
01217       if (L_cond_branch (oper))
01218         {
01219           epilogue_cb = L_find_branch_dest (oper);
01220           if (!L_find_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, "epilogue"))
01221             L_punt ("Lpipe_remove_empty_epilogues: Expected to find "
01222                     "epilogue attribute, but did not.  "
01223                     "Cb: %d, Function: %s\n", epilogue_cb->id, fn->name);
01224 
01225           last_oper = epilogue_cb->last_op;
01226           if (L_uncond_branch (last_oper))
01227             {
01228               dest_cb = L_find_branch_dest (last_oper);
01229               if (L_find_attr (dest_cb->attr, "rename_comp_code"))
01230                 {
01231                   if (dest_cb->first_op == NULL)
01232                     Lpipe_remove_comp_code_block (dest_cb);
01233                   else if (L_uncond_branch (dest_cb->first_op))
01234                     Lpipe_remove_comp_code_block (dest_cb);
01235                 }
01236             }
01237 
01238           if (epilogue_cb->first_op == NULL)
01239             {
01240               empty_epilogue = 1;
01241               fall_thru_cb = epilogue_cb->next_cb;
01242             }
01243           else if (L_uncond_branch (epilogue_cb->first_op))
01244             {
01245               empty_epilogue = 1;
01246               fall_thru_cb = L_find_branch_dest (epilogue_cb->first_op);
01247             }
01248           else
01249             {
01250               empty_epilogue = 0;
01251             }
01252 
01253           if (empty_epilogue)
01254             Lpipe_remove_epilogue (fn, oper, prologue_cb, epilogue_cb,
01255                                    fall_thru_cb, TARGET_EPI);
01256         }
01257     }
01258 
01259   for (oper = header_cb->first_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
01260     {
01261       if (L_cond_branch (oper))
01262         {
01263           if (oper == header_cb->last_op)
01264             epilogue_cb = header_cb->next_cb;
01265           else
01266             epilogue_cb = L_find_branch_dest (oper);
01267 
01268           if (!L_find_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, "epilogue"))
01269             L_punt ("Lpipe_remove_empty_epilogues: Expected to find "
01270                     "epilogue attribute, but did not.  "
01271                     "Cb: %d, Function: %s\n", epilogue_cb->id, fn->name);
01272 
01273           last_oper = epilogue_cb->last_op;
01274           if (L_uncond_branch (last_oper))
01275             {
01276               dest_cb = L_find_branch_dest (last_oper);
01277               if (L_find_attr (dest_cb->attr, "rename_comp_code"))
01278                 {
01279                   if (dest_cb->first_op == NULL)
01280                     Lpipe_remove_comp_code_block (dest_cb);
01281                   else if (L_uncond_branch (dest_cb->first_op))
01282                     Lpipe_remove_comp_code_block (dest_cb);
01283                 }
01284 
01285               empty_epilogue = 0;
01286               fall_thru_cb = NULL;
01287               if (epilogue_cb->first_op == NULL)
01288                 {
01289                   empty_epilogue = 1;
01290                   fall_thru_cb = epilogue_cb->next_cb;
01291                 }
01292               else if (L_uncond_branch (epilogue_cb->first_op))
01293                 {
01294                   empty_epilogue = 1;
01295                   fall_thru_cb = L_find_branch_dest (epilogue_cb->first_op);
01296                 }
01297 
01298               if (empty_epilogue)
01299                 {
01300                   if (oper != header_cb->last_op)
01301                     Lpipe_remove_epilogue (fn, oper, header_cb, epilogue_cb,
01302                                            fall_thru_cb, TARGET_EPI);
01303                   /* can only remove epilogue for loop back branch if epilogue
01304                      falls through to original loop fall through path */
01305                   else if (fall_thru_cb == epilogue_cb->next_cb)
01306                     Lpipe_remove_epilogue (fn, oper, header_cb, epilogue_cb,
01307                                            fall_thru_cb, FALL_THRU_EPI);
01308                 }
01309             }
01310         }
01311     }
01312 }
01313 
01314 
01315 
01316 
01317 /*------------------------------------------------------------------------
01318                      Muliple epilogue code schema
01319                      with rotating registers
01320   ------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01321 
01322 L_Oper *
01323 Lpipe_gen_epilogue_counter (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * cb, int i, int top)
01324 {
01325   L_Oper *epilogue_cntr_init = NULL, *new_op = NULL;
01326   L_Operand *epilogue_cntr_operand = NULL;
01327 
01328   /* If no specific register is returned from mspec, assume
01329      a virtual register can be used. */
01330   if (!(epilogue_cntr_operand = M_return_epilogue_cntr_register ()))
01331     epilogue_cntr_operand =
01332       L_new_register_operand (++(fn->max_reg_id),
01333                               M_native_int_register_ctype (), L_PTYPE_NULL);
01334 
01335   epilogue_cntr_init =
01336     Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (epilogue_cntr_operand,
01337                                       L_new_gen_int_operand (i));
01338 
01339   if (top)
01340     L_insert_oper_before (cb, cb->first_op, epilogue_cntr_init);
01341   else                          /* bottom */
01342     L_insert_oper_after (cb, cb->last_op, epilogue_cntr_init);
01343 
01344   L_annotate_oper (fn, cb, epilogue_cntr_init);
01345   new_op = epilogue_cntr_init->prev_op; /* Annotate always insert op before. */
01346   L_delete_oper (cb, epilogue_cntr_init);
01347 
01348   return new_op;
01349 }
01350 
01351 
01352 L_Oper *
01353 Lpipe_gen_loop_counter (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * cb, int i, int top)
01354 {
01355   L_Oper *loop_cntr_init = NULL, *new_op = NULL;
01356   L_Operand *loop_cntr_operand = NULL;
01357 
01358   /* If no specific register is returned from mspec, assume
01359      a virtual register can be used. */
01360   if (!(loop_cntr_operand = M_return_loop_cntr_register ()))
01361     loop_cntr_operand = L_new_register_operand (++(fn->max_reg_id),
01362                                                 M_native_int_register_ctype
01363                                                 (), L_PTYPE_NULL);
01364 
01365   loop_cntr_init = Lpipe_gen_mov_consuming_operands (loop_cntr_operand,
01366                                                      L_new_gen_int_operand
01367                                                      (i));
01368 
01369   if (top)
01370     L_insert_oper_before (cb, cb->first_op, loop_cntr_init);
01371   else                          /* bottom */
01372     L_insert_oper_after (cb, cb->last_op, loop_cntr_init);
01373   L_annotate_oper (fn, cb, loop_cntr_init);
01374   new_op = loop_cntr_init->prev_op;     /* Annotate always insert op before. */
01375   L_delete_oper (cb, loop_cntr_init);
01376 
01377   return new_op;
01378 }
01379 
01380 
01381 /* For the multiple epilogue code schema, the copies of the loop back
01382    branch are turned into exits by changing the branch direction. */
01383 static void
01384 Lpipe_change_branch_dir (L_Oper * branch, L_Cb * target)
01385 {
01386   /* change ble to bgt, etc. */
01387   L_negate_compare (branch);
01388 
01389   /* new target is the epilogue associated with this exit */
01390   L_change_branch_dest (branch, L_find_branch_dest (branch), target);
01391 }
01392 
01393 /* Generate an epilogue for an exit branch from the prologue.  Place all
01394    partial epilogues at the end of the function. */
01395 static void
01396 Lpipe_gen_partial_epi_rot (L_Func * fn, L_Cb * header_cb, L_Oper * exit_branch,
01397                      L_Cb * fall_thru_cb, int ii, int stage_count)
01398 {
01399   L_Cb *epilogue_cb;
01400   L_Cb *exit_cb;
01401   L_Flow *new_flow;
01402   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_branch_info;
01403   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info;
01404   int pro_stage;                /* stage of prologue which contains exit br */
01405   int epi_stage;                /* current epilogue stage number */
01406   int iter_stage;               /* stage of iteration which contains oper */
01407   L_Oper *first_oper;
01408   L_Oper *last_oper;
01409   L_Oper *oper;
01410   L_Oper *new_oper;
01411   L_Attr *attr;
01412   int theta;                    /* intra-iter stage containing exit branch */
01413   int do_copy;                  /* flag indicating current oper should be
01414                                    copied to epilogue */
01415   L_Oper *exit_branch_copy;     /* corresponding copy of prologue exit branch
01416                                    in kernel */
01417 
01418   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
01419 
01420   /* Create epilogue cb and add it to control flow graph.  The 
01421      epilogue cbs for exits from the prologue are placed at the end
01422      of the function because it is assumed that most of the time the
01423      kernel will be entered. */
01424   epilogue_cb = L_create_cb (UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01425   L_insert_cb_after (fn, fn->last_cb, epilogue_cb);
01426   attr = L_new_attr ("epilogue", 0);
01427   epilogue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, attr);
01428 
01429   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
01430     {
01431       epilogue_cb->flags =
01432         L_SET_BIT_FLAG (epilogue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
01433     }
01434 
01435   /* prologue to epilogue flows */
01436   new_flow = L_new_flow (1, prologue_cb, epilogue_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01437   prologue_cb->dest_flow = L_insert_flow_before (prologue_cb->dest_flow,
01438                                                  prologue_cb->dest_flow,
01439                                                  new_flow);
01440   epilogue_cb->src_flow =
01441     L_new_flow (1, prologue_cb, epilogue_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01442 
01443   /* find exit cb */
01444 
01445   exit_cb = exit_branch_info->loop_back_br ?
01446     fall_thru_cb : L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
01447 
01448   /* epilogue to exit cb flows */
01449   epilogue_cb->dest_flow =
01450     L_new_flow (1, epilogue_cb, exit_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01451   new_flow = L_new_flow (1, epilogue_cb, exit_cb, UNKNOWN_WEIGHT);
01452   exit_cb->src_flow = L_insert_flow_before (exit_cb->src_flow,
01453                                             exit_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
01454 
01455   /* If oper is a copy of the loop back branch, change condition of branch so
01456      it is now taken when it used to fall thru and change target of branch.
01457      Otherwise, just change branch target. */
01458   if (exit_branch_info->loop_back_br)
01459     {
01460       Lpipe_change_branch_dir (exit_branch, epilogue_cb);
01461     }
01462   else
01463     {
01464       L_change_branch_dest (exit_branch, L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch),
01465                             epilogue_cb);
01466     }
01467 
01468   /* Generate the stages of the epilogue from first to last.  The
01469      first stage of the epilogue is called stage 0.  Epilogue stage 0 is for
01470      the opers remaining in same kernel copy as the exit branch.  The number
01471      of stages in the epilogue is reduced by theta.  Start copying
01472      from the kernel copy which contains the exit branch and wrap around
01473      the kernel until all epilogue stages are generated. */
01474   theta = exit_branch_info->stage;
01475   pro_stage = exit_branch_info->prologue_stage;
01476   for (epi_stage = 0; epi_stage < stage_count - theta; epi_stage++)
01477     {
01478       first_oper = header_cb->first_op;
01479       last_oper = header_cb->last_op;;
01480 
01481       if (epi_stage == 0)
01482         {
01483           exit_branch_copy =
01484             Lpipe_find_exit_branch_copy (exit_branch, first_oper, last_oper);
01485 
01486           /* if exit branch is the last oper in stage - i.e., a copy of the
01487              loop back branch, there will be no opers in epilogue stage 0 */
01488 
01489           if (exit_branch_copy == last_oper)
01490             continue;
01491           first_oper = exit_branch_copy->next_op;
01492         }
01493 
01494       for (oper = first_oper; oper != NULL; oper = oper->next_op)
01495         {
01496           if (!Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
01497             {
01498               softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01499               iter_stage = softpipe_info->stage;
01500 
01501               /* At stage x of epilogue, insts from stage x-1+theta of the 
01502                  final iteration are already executed.  Therefore only insts
01503                  from stage x+theta or later of the pipeline are included.
01504                  This effectively excludes instructions from iterations after
01505                  the final iteration since those iterations are executing in 
01506                  earlier stages.  If the oper is from the final iteration,
01507                  only copy if it was originally above the branch in the
01508                  original loop body. 
01509 
01510                  In the prologue, execution of the pipeline is ramping up so,
01511                  if an exit branch is taken, there are not as many iterations
01512                  that need to be finished up as in the kernel.  Therefore
01513                  don't copy instructions from any stage later than the
01514                  stage that the first iteration is currently executing.  For
01515                  an exit from prologue stage pro_stage and during epilogue
01516                  stage epi_stage, the first iteration is executing stage
01517                  pro_stage + epi_stage.  */
01518 
01519               do_copy = 1;
01520               if (iter_stage < (epi_stage + theta))
01521                 {
01522                   do_copy = 0;
01523                 }
01524               if (iter_stage == (epi_stage + theta) &&
01525                   softpipe_info->home_block > exit_branch_info->home_block)
01526                 {
01527                   do_copy = 0;
01528                 }
01529               if (iter_stage > (pro_stage + epi_stage))
01530                 {
01531                   do_copy = 0;
01532                 }
01533 
01534               if (do_copy)
01535                 {
01536                   L_punt ("Lpipe_gen_partial_epi_rot: Can't rotate all "
01537                           "registers because some might be invariant!\n");
01538 #if 0
01539                   Softpipe_Op_Info *new_info;
01540                   int j;
01541 
01542                   new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
01543                   new_oper->ext =
01544                     (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
01545                   new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
01546                   /* issue time relative to beginning of epilogue */
01547                   new_info->issue_time = epi_stage * ii +
01548                     softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
01549                   new_info->epilogue_stage = epi_stage;
01550                   L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op,
01551                                        new_oper);
01552 
01553                   /* For epi stage 0, we use the same registers as in the
01554                      current kernel iteration.  When writing subsequent
01555                      epi stages, a rotation would have occurred, 
01556                      moving the contents of register x into x+1.  
01557                      So, we need to adjust the register values by -1 
01558                      for each rotation that would have occurred. */
01559 
01560                   for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
01561                     if (L_is_register (new_oper->dest[j]))
01562                       new_oper->dest[j]->value.r -= epi_stage;
01563                   for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
01564                     if (L_is_register (new_oper->src[j]))
01565                       new_oper->src[j]->value.r -= epi_stage;
01566                   for (j = 0; j < L_max_pred_operand; j++)
01567                     if (L_is_register (new_oper->pred[j]))
01568                       new_oper->pred[j]->value.r -= epi_stage;
01569 #endif
01570                 }
01571 
01572               if (oper == last_oper)
01573                 break;
01574             }
01575         }
01576     }
01577   /* add jump to fall through cb */
01578   if (epilogue_cb->next_cb != exit_cb)
01579     {
01580       new_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_JUMP);
01581       new_oper->src[0] = L_new_cb_operand (exit_cb);
01582       L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
01583       L_annotate_oper (fn, epilogue_cb, new_oper);
01584       L_delete_oper (epilogue_cb, new_oper);
01585     }
01586 
01587   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_epilogue (epilogue_cb);
01588   return;
01589 }
01590 
01591 
01592 /* Generate an epilogue for an exit branch from the kernel. */
01593 /* fall through path of original loop body */
01594 /* flag indicating whether epilogue is the target
01595    of an exit branch, or on the fall through
01596    path of the kernel */
01597 static void
01598 Lpipe_gen_epi_rot (SM_Cb *sm_cb, L_Oper *exit_branch, L_Cb *fall_thru_cb,
01599                    int epi_type)
01600 {
01601   int stage_count = sm_cb->stages;
01602   L_Cb *header_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb, *epilogue_cb, *exit_cb;
01603   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
01604   double epi_weight;            /* weight of epilogue cb */
01605   L_Flow *new_flow;
01606   Softpipe_Op_Info *exit_branch_info, *softpipe_info;
01607   L_Oper *first_oper, *last_oper, *oper, *new_oper;
01608   L_Attr *attr;
01609   int epi_stage;
01610   int theta;                    /* intra-iter stage containing exit branch */
01611 
01612   exit_branch_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (exit_branch);
01613 
01614   /* Create epilogue cb and add it to control flow graph.  The last 
01615      epilogue cb created is placed the closest to the kernel cb. */
01616 
01617   epi_weight = exit_branch_info->exit_weight;
01618   epilogue_cb = L_create_cb (epi_weight);
01619   L_insert_cb_after (fn, header_cb, epilogue_cb);
01620   attr = L_new_attr ("epilogue", 0);
01621   epilogue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (epilogue_cb->attr, attr);
01622   epilogue_cb->flags =
01623     L_SET_BIT_FLAG (epilogue_cb->flags, L_CB_ROT_REG_ALLOCATED);
01624 
01625   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
01626     epilogue_cb->flags =
01627       L_SET_BIT_FLAG (epilogue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
01628 
01629   {
01630     /* Splice the epilogue_cb into the CFG */
01631 
01632     int tk = (epi_type != FALL_THRU_EPI);
01633     
01634     new_flow = L_new_flow (tk, header_cb, epilogue_cb, epi_weight);  
01635     epilogue_cb->src_flow = L_copy_single_flow (new_flow);
01636 
01637     if (!tk)
01638       header_cb->dest_flow = L_concat_flow (header_cb->dest_flow, new_flow);
01639     else
01640       header_cb->dest_flow = L_insert_flow_before (header_cb->dest_flow,
01641                                                    header_cb->dest_flow,
01642                                                    new_flow);
01643 
01644     /* find exit cb */
01645 
01646     exit_cb = exit_branch_info->loop_back_br ? 
01647       fall_thru_cb : L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch);
01648 
01649     /* epilogue to exit cb flows */
01650 
01651     new_flow = L_new_flow ((epilogue_cb->next_cb != exit_cb), 
01652                            epilogue_cb, exit_cb, epi_weight);
01653     epilogue_cb->dest_flow = L_copy_single_flow (new_flow);
01654 
01655     exit_cb->src_flow = L_insert_flow_before (exit_cb->src_flow,
01656                                               exit_cb->src_flow, new_flow);
01657   }
01658 
01659   /* If oper is a copy of the loop back branch, change condition of branch so
01660      it is now taken when it used to fall thru and change target of branch.
01661      Otherwise, just change target of branch. */
01662 
01663   if (epi_type == TARGET_EPI)
01664     {
01665       if (exit_branch_info->loop_back_br)
01666         Lpipe_change_branch_dir (exit_branch, epilogue_cb);
01667       else
01668         L_change_branch_dest (exit_branch, L_find_branch_dest (exit_branch),
01669                               epilogue_cb);
01670     }
01671 
01672   /* Generate the stages of the epilogue from first to last.  The 
01673      first stage of the epilogue is called stage 0.  Epilogue stage 0 is for
01674      the opers remaining in same kernel copy as the exit branch.  The number
01675      of stages in the epilogue is reduced by theta.  Start copying 
01676      from the kernel copy which contains the exit branch and wrap around 
01677      the kernel until all epilogue stages are generated. */
01678 
01679   theta = exit_branch_info->stage;
01680 
01681   for (epi_stage = 0; epi_stage < stage_count - theta; epi_stage++)
01682     {
01683       last_oper = header_cb->last_op;
01684 
01685       if (epi_stage == 0)
01686         {
01687           /* if exit branch is the last oper in stage - i.e., a copy of the
01688              loop back branch, there will be no opers in epilogue stage 0 */
01689           if (exit_branch == last_oper)
01690             continue;
01691           first_oper = exit_branch->next_op;
01692         }
01693       else
01694         {
01695           first_oper = header_cb->first_op;
01696         }
01697 
01698       for (oper = first_oper; oper; oper = oper->next_op)
01699         {
01700           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01701 
01702           if (Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
01703             continue;
01704 
01705           if (softpipe_info->stage <= (epi_stage + theta))
01706             continue;
01707 
01708           L_punt ("Lpipe_gen_epi_rot: Can't rotate all registers because "
01709                   "some might be invariant!\n");
01710 
01711 #if 0
01712           int ii = sm_cb->II, j, rotate;
01713           Softpipe_Op_Info *new_info;
01714           new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
01715           new_oper->ext = (void *)Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
01716           new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
01717           /* issue time relative to beginning of epilogue */
01718           new_info->issue_time = epi_stage * ii +
01719             softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
01720           new_info->epilogue_stage = epi_stage;
01721           L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op,
01722                                new_oper);
01723 
01724           /* For epi stage 0, we use the same registers as in the
01725              current kernel iteration.  When writing subsequent
01726              epi stages, a rotation would have occurred, 
01727              moving the contents of register x into x+1.  
01728              So, we need to adjust the register
01729              values by -1 for each rotation that would have occurred.
01730              
01731              Actually, when we execute epi stage 0 from kernel,
01732              we get an additional rotation at the exit of the loop
01733              through the rotating register branch.  When we exit
01734              from the prologue, then we are executing a non-rotating
01735              branch and the registers are the same as in the kernel. */
01736 
01737           rotate = (epi_type == TARGET_EPI) ? epi_stage : epi_stage + 1;
01738 
01739           for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
01740             if (L_is_register (new_oper->dest[j]))
01741               new_oper->dest[j]->value.r -= rotate;
01742 
01743           for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
01744             if (L_is_register (new_oper->src[j]))
01745               new_oper->src[j]->value.r -= rotate;
01746 
01747           for (j = 0; j < L_max_pred_operand; j++)
01748             if (L_is_register (new_oper->pred[j]))
01749               new_oper->pred[j]->value.r -= rotate;
01750 #endif
01751           if (oper == last_oper)
01752             break;
01753         }
01754     }
01755 
01756   /* add jump to fall through cb */
01757   if (epilogue_cb->next_cb != exit_cb)
01758     {
01759       new_oper = L_create_new_op (Lop_JUMP);
01760       new_oper->src[0] = L_new_cb_operand (exit_cb);
01761       L_insert_oper_after (epilogue_cb, epilogue_cb->last_op, new_oper);
01762       L_annotate_oper (fn, epilogue_cb, new_oper);
01763       L_delete_oper (epilogue_cb, new_oper);
01764     }
01765 
01766   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_epilogue (epilogue_cb);
01767 
01768   return;
01769 }
01770 
01771 
01772 /* generate multiple epilogues with rotating registers */
01773 void
01774 Lpipe_multi_epi_gen_rot (SM_Cb *sm_cb, L_Oper *loop_back_br)
01775 {
01776   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
01777   L_Cb *kernel_cb = sm_cb->lcode_cb, *dest_cb, *fall_thru_cb;
01778   L_Flow *flow, *src_flow, *next_flow, *fall_thru_flow, *loop_back_flow;
01779   L_Oper *oper, *last_oper, *new_oper;
01780   Softpipe_Op_Info *softpipe_info, *new_info;
01781   int i, j, stage_count = sm_cb->stages, ii = sm_cb->II;
01782   int stg_ofst;
01783 
01784   /* find loop back flow */
01785   loop_back_flow = L_find_flow_with_dst_cb (kernel_cb->dest_flow, kernel_cb);
01786 
01787   /* create prologue cb */
01788   prologue_cb = L_create_cb (preheader_cb->dest_flow->weight);
01789   L_insert_cb_before (fn, kernel_cb, prologue_cb);
01790 
01791   prologue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (prologue_cb->attr,
01792                                      L_new_attr ("prologue", 0));
01793   prologue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (prologue_cb->flags,
01794                                        L_CB_ROT_REG_ALLOCATED);
01795 
01796   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (kernel_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
01797     prologue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (prologue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
01798 
01799   /* preheader to prologue flows */
01800   if (preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb != kernel_cb)
01801     L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: dest cb for preheader flow is not header:"
01802             " preheader_cb is %d, kernel_cb is %d, dest of flow is %d\n",
01803             preheader_cb->id, kernel_cb->id,
01804             preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb->id);
01805 
01806   preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb = prologue_cb;
01807   prologue_cb->src_flow = L_new_flow (preheader_cb->dest_flow->cc,
01808                                       preheader_cb, prologue_cb,
01809                                       prologue_cb->weight);
01810 
01811   /* Prologue to kernel flows.  Assume only flows into kernel cb are
01812      from preheader and loop back branch */
01813   flow = kernel_cb->src_flow;
01814   if (flow->src_cb == kernel_cb)
01815     flow = flow->next_flow;
