01816   flow->src_cb = prologue_cb;
01817 
01818   prologue_cb->dest_flow = L_new_flow (flow->cc, prologue_cb, kernel_cb,
01819                                        prologue_cb->weight);
01820 
01821   /* Generate the stages of the prologue from last to first.  The
01822      stages of the prologue are numbered 0 through stage_count-2.  The
01823      last stage of the prologue should be a copy of kernel_copy[unroll
01824      - 1] with instructions from the last intra-iteration stage
01825      deleted.  Each preceding stage of the prologue is copied from the
01826      preceding kernel copy modulo unroll.  The number of stages in the
01827      prologue may be larger than the degree of unrolling of the
01828      kernel, so as the copy number is decremented, it may become
01829      negative, producing and invalid copy number.  So, we start
01830      copying using a copy number which is at least as large as the
01831      number of stages in the prologue and which, modulo unroll, is
01832      equal to unroll-1.
01833 
01834      There are less than stage_count stages in the prologue, so
01835      (stage_count / unroll + 1) is an upper bound on the number of
01836      copies of the unrolled kernel needed to make the prologue (note
01837      that stage_count does not have to be a multiple of unroll).
01838      (stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll is an upper bound on the
01839      number of kernel stages that need to be copied.  This number
01840      modulo unroll is 0.  ((stage_count / unroll + 1) * unroll - 1)
01841      modulo unroll gives unroll - 1.  Thus, starting_copy modulo
01842      unroll gives the kernel copy needed for the last stage of the
01843      prologue.  The second to the last stage of the prologue is copied
01844      from kernel_copy[(starting_copy - 1) mod unroll)] and so on.
01845      Since starting_copy is an upper bound on the number of kernel
01846      stages that need to be copied, i below will remain positive until
01847      all stages of the prologue have been generated.
01848 
01849      This is actually much simpler.  There are stage_count - 1 kernel
01850      copies in the prologue.  Replicate the kernel, deleting
01851      instructions for stages not present in the particular prologue
01852      stage.
01853 
01854      Start generating from the LAST stage of the prologue which 
01855      is stage_count-2, then working toward stage 0. */
01856 
01857   for (i = stage_count - 2, stg_ofst = 1; i >= 0; i--, stg_ofst++)
01858     {
01859       for (oper = kernel_cb->last_op; oper; oper = oper->prev_op)
01860         {
01861           Lpipe_MVEInfo *mve_info;
01862           Lpipe_LRInfo *lr_info;
01863 
01864           if (Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
01865             continue;
01866 
01867           softpipe_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper);
01868 
01869           /* At stage x of prologue, instructions from stage x+1 of the
01870              pipeline (and later) are not executed (the first 
01871              iteration has not progressed that far yet). */
01872           if (softpipe_info->stage > i)
01873             continue;
01874 
01875           new_oper = L_copy_operation (oper);
01876           new_oper->ext =
01877             (Softpipe_Op_Info *) Lpipe_copy_op_info (softpipe_info);
01878           new_info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (new_oper);
01879           new_info->prologue_stage = i;
01880           /* issue time relative to beginning of prologue */
01881           new_info->issue_time = i * ii +
01882             softpipe_info->intra_iter_issue_time % ii;
01883           L_insert_oper_before (prologue_cb, prologue_cb->first_op,
01884                                 new_oper);
01885 
01886           /* Undo the effect of the register rotation between stages
01887            * of the prologue.  At the boundary of the prologue to the
01888            * kernel, each of the live registers in all active
01889            * iterations have a unique location in the physical
01890            * register file.  Rather than rotate, preserve these
01891            * locations backward into the prologue. The last stage of
01892            * the prologue (not the last stage of each iteration)
01893            * should have the register IDs incremented by one to
01894            * account for the shift that would have taken place. */
01895 
01896           for (j = 0; j < L_max_dest_operand; j++)
01897             {
01898               if (!L_is_register (new_oper->dest[j]) ||
01899                   !(mve_info = softpipe_info->dest_mve_info[j]) ||
01900                   (mve_info->live_range->num_names <= 1))
01901                 continue;
01902               lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01903               new_oper->dest[j]->value.r = 
01904                 Lpipe_get_pro_reg (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info, stg_ofst);
01905             }
01906           for (j = 0; j < L_max_src_operand; j++)
01907             {
01908               if (!L_is_register (new_oper->src[j]) ||
01909                   !(mve_info = softpipe_info->src_mve_info[j]) ||
01910                   (mve_info->live_range->num_names <= 1))
01911                 continue;                 
01912               lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01913               new_oper->src[j]->value.r = 
01914                 Lpipe_get_pro_reg (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info, stg_ofst);
01915             }
01916           for (j = 0; j < L_max_pred_operand; j++)
01917             {
01918               if (!L_is_register (new_oper->pred[j]) ||
01919                   !(mve_info = softpipe_info->pred_mve_info[j]) ||
01920                   (mve_info->live_range->num_names <= 1))
01921                 continue;
01922               lr_info = mve_info->live_range;
01923               new_oper->pred[j]->value.r = 
01924                 Lpipe_get_pro_reg (sm_cb, lr_info, mve_info, stg_ofst);
01925             }
01926         }
01927     }
01928 
01929   /* adjust sync arcs after prologue generation */
01930   Lpipe_adjust_syncs_for_prologue ();
01931 
01932   /* generate mutliple epilogues */
01933 
01934   /* find fall through flow of original loop.  This may be NULL. */
01935   fall_thru_flow = loop_back_flow->next_flow;
01936 
01937   /* delete flows corresponding to every branch in the original loop except
01938      the loop back branch */
01939   for (flow = kernel_cb->dest_flow; flow != loop_back_flow; flow = next_flow)
01940     {
01941       if (flow == fall_thru_flow)
01942         L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen_rot: Unlinking flows:"
01943                 "tried to unlink the fall-through flow\n");
01944       next_flow = flow->next_flow;
01945       dest_cb = flow->dst_cb;
01946       src_flow = L_find_matching_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, flow);
01947       dest_cb->src_flow = L_delete_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, src_flow);
01948       kernel_cb->dest_flow = L_delete_flow (kernel_cb->dest_flow, flow);
01949     }
01950 
01951   /* delete flow from header cb to fall through cb since all exits from
01952      header will go to epilogues. There may not be a fall through flow/cb. */
01953   if (fall_thru_flow)
01954     {
01955       fall_thru_cb = fall_thru_flow->dst_cb;
01956       src_flow =
01957         L_find_matching_flow (fall_thru_cb->src_flow, fall_thru_flow);
01958       fall_thru_cb->src_flow =
01959         L_delete_flow (fall_thru_cb->src_flow, src_flow);
01960       kernel_cb->dest_flow =
01961         L_delete_flow (kernel_cb->dest_flow, fall_thru_flow);
01962     }
01963   else
01964     {
01965       fall_thru_cb = NULL;
01966     }
01967 
01968   /* Generate multiple epilogues from the second to last branch in the
01969      kernel to the first branch.  Generate the epilogues in this order
01970      to make it easy to insert the flows into the header cb. 
01971      Each new epilogue is inserted right after
01972      the kernel, so the last epilogue generated is laid out the closest
01973      to the kernel.  Generate the epilogue for the loop back
01974      branch last because the kernel reaches this epilogue by falling
01975      through the loop back branch. */
01976 
01977   last_oper = kernel_cb->last_op;
01978   for (oper = last_oper->prev_op; oper; oper = oper->prev_op)
01979     {
01980       if (oper == loop_back_br)
01981         L_punt ("Encountered loop back branch in epi gen!");
01982       else if (L_cond_branch (oper))
01983         Lpipe_gen_epi_rot (sm_cb, oper, fall_thru_cb, TARGET_EPI);
01984       else if (L_uncond_branch (oper))
01985         L_punt ("MCM Should never get here.");
01986     }
01987 
01988   /* generate the epilogue for the fall through path of the loop
01989      back branch if it is a conditional branch */
01990 
01991   if (L_cond_branch (last_oper))
01992     Lpipe_gen_epi_rot (sm_cb, last_oper, fall_thru_cb, FALL_THRU_EPI);
01993 
01994   /* Generate epilogues for exits from the prologue.  Prologue may be 
01995      empty if stage_count = 1. */
01996 
01997   if ((last_oper = prologue_cb->last_op))
01998     {
01999       /* Generate partial epilogues for other exits from prologue.  Go from
02000          last branch to first branch.  Place all partial epilogues at the
02001          end of the function.  */
02002       for (oper = last_oper; oper; oper = oper->prev_op)
02003         {
02004           if (L_cond_branch (oper))
02005             Lpipe_gen_partial_epi_rot (fn, kernel_cb, oper, fall_thru_cb, 
02006                                        ii, stage_count);
02007           else if (L_uncond_branch (oper))
02008             L_punt ("MCM Should never get here.");
02009         }
02010     }
02011   else if (stage_count > 1)
02012     {
02013       L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: stage count is greater than 1, "
02014               "but prologue is empty.  cb = %d\n", kernel_cb->id);
02015     }
02016 
02017 
02018   {
02019     L_Oper *epilogue_cntr_init;
02020     L_Operand *epilogue_cntr_operand;
02021 
02022     epilogue_cntr_init = Lpipe_gen_epilogue_counter (fn, prologue_cb, 1, 0);
02023     epilogue_cntr_operand = epilogue_cntr_init->dest[0];
02024 
02025 #if 0
02026     /* Alter the loop back branch to branch when the epilogue counter is
02027        non-zero or follow its condition when the epilogue counter is 0.
02028        This branch must also perform register rotation and decrement
02029        the epilogue counter when it is not zero. */
02030 
02031     if (!(isl_attr = L_find_attr (loop_back_br->attr, "isl")))
02032       L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen_rot: Unable to find the isl for the loop"
02033               "back branch.");
02034 
02035     loop_back_br->src[3] = L_copy_operand (epilogue_cntr_operand);
02036     loop_back_br->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (epilogue_cntr_operand);
02037 
02038     /* Set the latency on dest[0] to 1...automatically creates the field. */
02039     L_set_int_attr_field (isl_attr, 2, 1);
02040 #endif
02041   }
02042 
02043   loop_back_br->flags =
02044     L_SET_BIT_FLAG (loop_back_br->flags, L_OPER_ROTATE_REGISTERS);
02045 
02046   /* 20031119 SZU */
02047   if (M_arch == M_TAHOE)
02048     {
02049       if (loop_back_br->proc_opc != TAHOEop_BR_CLOOP)
02050         loop_back_br->proc_opc = TAHOEop_BR_WTOP;
02051       else
02052         loop_back_br->proc_opc = TAHOEop_BR_CTOP;
02053     }
02054 
02055   return;
02056 }
02057 
02058 
02059 /* generate multiple epilogues */
02060 void
02061 Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot (SM_Cb *sm_cb, L_Oper *loop_back_br)
02062 {
02063   L_Func *fn = sm_cb->lcode_fn;
02064   int stage_count = sm_cb->stages;
02065   int int_base, int_num, flt_base, flt_num, dbl_base, dbl_num, pred_base,
02066     pred_num;
02067   L_Operand *epilogue_cntr_operand = NULL;
02068   L_Operand *pred = NULL;
02069   L_Oper *epilogue_cntr_init = NULL;
02070   L_Oper *new_op, *oper = NULL, *last_oper;
02071   L_Attr *isl_attr = NULL, *attr = NULL;
02072   int loop;
02073   int loop_back_stage;
02074   Softpipe_Op_Info *info = NULL;
02075   L_Cb *prologue_cb = NULL, *dest_cb = NULL, *fall_thru_cb = NULL;
02076   L_Flow *flow = NULL, *next_flow = NULL, *src_flow = NULL;
02077   L_Flow *fall_thru_flow;       /* flow for fall thru path of loop back br  */
02078   L_Flow *loop_back_flow;       /* flow corresponding to taken loop back br */
02079 
02080   /* find loop back flow */
02081   loop_back_flow = L_find_flow_with_dst_cb (header_cb->dest_flow, header_cb);
02082 
02083   /* create prologue cb */
02084   prologue_cb = L_create_cb (preheader_cb->dest_flow->weight);
02085   L_insert_cb_before (fn, header_cb, prologue_cb);
02086   attr = L_new_attr ("prologue", 0);
02087   prologue_cb->attr = L_concat_attr (prologue_cb->attr, attr);
02088   prologue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (prologue_cb->flags,
02089                                        L_CB_ROT_REG_ALLOCATED);
02090 
02091   if (L_EXTRACT_BIT_VAL (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK))
02092     prologue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (prologue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
02093 
02094   /* preheader to prologue flows */
02095   if (preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb != header_cb)
02096     L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen: dest cb for preheader flow is not header:"
02097             " preheader_cb is %d, header_cb is %d, dest of flow is %d\n",
02098             preheader_cb->id, header_cb->id,
02099             preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb->id);
02100 
02101   preheader_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb = prologue_cb;
02102   prologue_cb->src_flow = L_new_flow (preheader_cb->dest_flow->cc,
02103                                       preheader_cb, prologue_cb,
02104                                       prologue_cb->weight);
02105 
02106   /* Prologue to header flows.  Assume only flows into header cb are
02107      from preheader and loop back branch */
02108   flow = header_cb->src_flow;
02109   if (flow->src_cb == header_cb)
02110     flow = flow->next_flow;
02111   flow->src_cb = prologue_cb;
02112 
02113   prologue_cb->dest_flow = L_new_flow (flow->cc, prologue_cb, header_cb,
02114                                        prologue_cb->weight);
02115 
02116   /* Add epilogue counter to prologue as the number of stages - 1. */
02117   if (prologue_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb != header_cb)
02118     L_punt ("Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot: dest cb for prologuer flow is not header:"
02119             " prologue_cb is %d, header_cb is %d, dest of flow is %d\n",
02120             prologue_cb->id, header_cb->id,
02121             prologue_cb->dest_flow->dst_cb->id);
02122 
02123 #if 0
02124   epilogue_cntr_init = Lpipe_gen_epilogue_counter (fn, prologue_cb,
02125                                                    stage_count - 1, 0);
02126 #else
02127   epilogue_cntr_init = Lpipe_gen_epilogue_counter (fn, prologue_cb,
02128                                                    stage_count, 0);
02129 #endif
02130 
02131   epilogue_cntr_operand = epilogue_cntr_init->dest[0];
02132 
02133   /* Alter the loop back branch to branch when the epilogue counter is
02134      non-zero or follow its condition when the epilogue counter is 0.
02135      This branch must also perform register rotation and decrement
02136      the epilogue counter when it is not zero. */
02137 
02138   if ((isl_attr = L_find_attr (loop_back_br->attr, "isl")) == NULL)
02139     L_punt ("Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot: Unable to find the isl for the"
02140             "loop back branch.");
02141 
02142   loop_back_br->flags =
02143     L_SET_BIT_FLAG (loop_back_br->flags, L_OPER_ROTATE_REGISTERS);
02144   loop_back_br->src[3] = L_copy_operand (epilogue_cntr_operand);
02145   loop_back_br->dest[0] = L_copy_operand (epilogue_cntr_operand);
02146   /* Set the latency on dest[0] to 1...automatically creates the field. */
02147   L_set_int_attr_field (isl_attr, 2, 1);
02148   
02149   if (!(info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (loop_back_br)))
02150     L_punt ("Lpip_kernel_gen_rot: no SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO found for loop"
02151             "back branch.");
02152   loop_back_stage = info->stage;
02153 
02154   /* Assign the various instructions the appropriate predicate based
02155      on their stage.  For already predicated instructions, nothing
02156      additional should be needed. */
02157 
02158   R_get_rot_regs (L_fn, &int_base, &int_num, &flt_base, &flt_num,
02159                   &dbl_base, &dbl_num, &pred_base, &pred_num);
02160 
02161   /* Predicate all non-speculative stages.  The loop back comparison
02162      (pred define) must be made conditional so that if its incoming 
02163      predicate is 0, then no changes are made to the target predicates. */
02164   pred = NULL;
02165   for (oper = header_cb->last_op; oper != NULL; oper = oper->prev_op)
02166     {
02167       if (Lpipe_ignore_kernel_inst (oper))
02168         continue;
02169 
02170       if (!(info = SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO (oper)))
02171         L_punt ("Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot: "
02172                 "no SOFTPIPE_OP_INFO found for loop back branch.");
02173 
02174 #if 0
02175       /* Non-speculative stages begin with the stage that contains the 
02176          loop back branch and continue to the end of the iteration. */
02177       if (info->stage >= loop_back_stage)
02178         {
02179           if (oper == loop_back_br)
02180             {
02181               /* The loop back branch gets the predicate for the last
02182                  speculative stage, while its comparision will be in the
02183                  first non-speculative stage. */
02184               
02185               /* Save the loop back controlling predicate. */
02186               if (oper->pred[0])
02187                 pred = oper->pred[0];
02188               else
02189                 L_punt ("Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot: loop back without a "
02190                         "qualifying predicate.");
02191               
02192               oper->pred[0] =
02193                 L_new_register_operand (pred_base + info->stage - 1,
02194                                         L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, L_PTYPE_NULL);
02195             }
02196           else
02197             {
02198               if (!oper->pred[0])
02199                 oper->pred[0] =
02200                   L_new_register_operand (pred_base + info->stage,
02201                                           L_CTYPE_PREDICATE,
02202                                           L_PTYPE_NULL);
02203 
02204               if (L_same_operand (oper->dest[0], pred))
02205                 {
02206                   /* This is the loop back condition 
02207                      generating comparison. */
02208                   if (oper->dest[0]->ptype != L_PTYPE_UNCOND_T &&
02209                       oper->dest[0]->ptype != L_PTYPE_UNCOND_F)
02210                     L_punt ("Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot: "
02211                                 "loop back condition not uncondition.");
02212                   
02213                   if (L_is_ptype_uncond_t (oper->dest[0]))
02214                     L_assign_ptype_cond_t (oper->dest[0]);
02215                 }
02216               else if (L_same_operand (oper->dest[1], pred))
02217                 {
02218                   /* This is the loop back condition 
02219                      generating comparison. */
02220                   if (oper->dest[1]->ptype != L_PTYPE_UNCOND_T &&
02221                       oper->dest[1]->ptype != L_PTYPE_UNCOND_F)
02222                     {
02223                       L_punt ("Lpipe_kernel_gen_rot: "
02224                               "loop back condition not uncondition.");
02225                     }
02226                   
02227                   if (L_is_ptype_uncond_t (oper->dest[1]))
02228                     L_assign_ptype_cond_t (oper->dest[1]);
02229                 }
02230             }
02231         }
02232 #else
02233       if (!oper->pred[0] &&
02234           !(oper == loop_back_br &&
02235             (oper->opc == Lop_JUMP || oper->opc == Lop_JUMP_FS)))
02236         {
02237           oper->pred[0] =
02238             L_new_register_operand (pred_base + info->stage,
02239                                     L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, L_PTYPE_NULL);
02240         }
02241 #endif
02242     }
02243   
02244 #if 0
02245   L_delete_operand (pred);
02246 #endif
02247 
02248   /* Need to make sure that the stage predicates begin clear,
02249      except for the first predicate, which should be set. 
02250      Clear the other predicate registers since it is possible
02251      that they might be read (guarding an op) where it is never
02252      modified (destination of a staged compare). */
02253 
02254   pred = L_new_register_operand (pred_base, L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, L_PTYPE_NULL);
02255   new_op = Lpipe_gen_uncond_pred_define (NULL, NULL, pred, Lop_PRED_SET);
02256   L_insert_oper_after (prologue_cb, prologue_cb->last_op, new_op);
02257   L_annotate_oper (fn, prologue_cb, new_op);
02258   L_delete_oper (prologue_cb, new_op);
02259 
02260   for (loop = 1; loop < pred_num; loop++)
02261     {
02262       pred = L_new_register_operand (pred_base + loop,
02263                                      L_CTYPE_PREDICATE, L_PTYPE_NULL);
02264       new_op =
02265         Lpipe_gen_uncond_pred_define (NULL, NULL, pred, Lop_PRED_CLEAR);
02266       L_insert_oper_after (prologue_cb, prologue_cb->last_op, new_op);
02267     }
02268 
02269   /* Need to shift a 1 into the stage predicate stream when the
02270      loop back branch takes. */
02271   loop_back_br->dest[1] = L_new_register_operand (pred_base,
02272                                                   L_CTYPE_PREDICATE,
02273                                                   L_PTYPE_UNCOND_T);
02274   /* Set the latency on dest[1] to 1...automatically creates the field. */
02275   L_set_int_attr_field (isl_attr, 3, 1);
02276 
02277   /* Set the kernel hyperblock flag. */
02278   header_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (header_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
02279 
02280   /* Set the preheader hyperblock flag. */
02281   prologue_cb->flags = L_SET_BIT_FLAG (prologue_cb->flags, L_CB_HYPERBLOCK);
02282 
02283   /* generate mutliple epilogues */
02284 
02285   /* find fall through flow of original loop.  This may be NULL. */
02286   fall_thru_flow = loop_back_flow->next_flow;
02287 
02288   /* delete flows corresponding to every branch in the original loop except
02289      the loop back branch */
02290   for (flow = header_cb->dest_flow; flow != loop_back_flow; flow = next_flow)
02291     {
02292       if (flow == fall_thru_flow)
02293         L_punt ("Lpipe_multi_epi_gen_rot: Unlinking flows:"
02294                 "tried to unlink the fall-through flow\n");
02295       next_flow = flow->next_flow;
02296       dest_cb = flow->dst_cb;
02297       src_flow = L_find_matching_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, flow);
02298       dest_cb->src_flow = L_delete_flow (dest_cb->src_flow, src_flow);
02299       header_cb->dest_flow = L_delete_flow (header_cb->dest_flow, flow);
02300     }
02301 
02302   /* delete flow from header cb to fall through cb since all exits from
02303      header will go to epilogues. There may not be a fall through flow/cb. */
02304   if (fall_thru_flow != NULL)
02305     {
02306       fall_thru_cb = fall_thru_flow->dst_cb;
02307       src_flow =
02308         L_find_matching_flow (fall_thru_cb->src_flow, fall_thru_flow);
02309       fall_thru_cb->src_flow =
02310         L_delete_flow (fall_thru_cb->src_flow, src_flow);
02311       header_cb->dest_flow =
02312         L_delete_flow (header_cb->dest_flow, fall_thru_flow);
02313     }
02314   else
02315     {
02316       fall_thru_cb = NULL;
02317     }
02318 
02319   /* Generate multiple epilogues from the second to last branch in the
02320      kernel to the first branch.  Generate the epilogues in this order
02321      to make it easy to insert the flows into the header cb. 
02322      Each new epilogue is inserted right after
02323      the kernel, so the last epilogue generated is laid out the closest
02324      to the kernel.  Generate the epilogue for the loop back
02325      branch last because the kernel reaches this epilogue by falling
02326      through the loop back branch. */
02327 
02328   last_oper = header_cb->last_op;
02329   for (oper = last_oper->prev_op; oper; oper = oper->prev_op)
02330     {
02331       if (L_cond_branch (oper))
02332         {
02333           Lpipe_gen_epi_rot (sm_cb, oper, fall_thru_cb, TARGET_EPI);
02334         }
02335       else if (L_uncond_branch (oper))
02336         {
02337           L_punt ("MCM Should never get here.");
02338           /* if loop ends with unconditional jump, copies of this branch
02339              always fall through. No epilogue is generated.  */
02340           oper->ext = 0;
02341           L_delete_oper (header_cb, oper);
02342         }
02343     }
02344 
02345   /* generate the epilogue for the fall through path of the loop
02346      back branch if it is a conditional branch */
02347   if (L_cond_branch (last_oper))
02348     Lpipe_gen_epi_rot (sm_cb, last_oper, fall_thru_cb, FALL_THRU_EPI);
02349 
02350   return;
02351 }
